result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 6th [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI 6th [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Christopher R. Millis was found guilty of OWI 6th [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 14CF210.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant to be equipped with a SCRAM until until his agent deems it no longer necessary.  

Must have IID installed, a valid driver's license and proper insurance in order to operate a motor vehicle.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant to report for jail within 2 weeks.  Defendant to report to the kiosk every day until jail sentence starts.  Sentence to start immediately, if defendant tests positive.  EMP allowed according to jail rules.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 14CF210.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher R. Millis

records.addlTxt:

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: FIDR destroyed
DNA proof form.  Signed by defendant only.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he is pleading to.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 3, OWI 6th.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood. Felony warnings given.  Priors confirmed.  Defense stipulated as to a factual basis.  Court found that factual basis exists for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely voluntarily and intellegently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation with conditions.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 3 years probation, concurrent. The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 1 year jail concurrent, report within 2 weeks.  Report to kiosk every day until jail sentence starts.  Sentence to start immediatly if defendant tests positive.   EMP allowed according to jail rules. Must be equipped with a SCRAM unit until his agent deems it no longer necessary.  DL revoked for 3 years.  IID ordered for the same.  $600.00 fine, plus costs.  Must have IID installed., valid DL and insurance in order to operate a motor vehicle.  Maintain employment, per agent's direction.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA, and any programming agent requires.  Credit for 14 days, if revoked.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-06-2015 10:30 am

Pre-trial conference at 05-06-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 06-01-2015 03:00 pm.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Fredrickson.  Reading of information waived.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered NGP.  PTC & STC set.  Bond ordered continued.  Civil citations to track with criminal cases.

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA states the defendant will be waiving his right to preliminary hearing on 14CF210 & 14CF213.  Judge questions him regarding the right to a preliminary hearing and explains to him what that entails.  Court finds the defendant knowingly and intelligently waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Bound over for trial on both cases.  DA to file Information at a later date.  Arraignment is scheduled for 4-13-15 at 2:45 and 15CF8 & 15CF17 will be set for a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing on the same date and time.  Bond is continued.
Arraignment at 04-13-2015 02:45 pm
Inmate Furlough Request from JASO - not completed

This bond includes all criminal cases:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

When I asked if the DA's Office will need to draft a document for the furlough there was a discussion between the Judge, Gerald, and I.  Gerald said he would go to the jail and speak to Cpt. Ring and I said I will fax over a copy of the minutes.

Defendant appeared in person in custody from Jackson County Jail with SPD Paul Fredrickson present.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Fox motions the Court to allow the defendant to be released for a period of 4 hours with conditions to visit his father.  Attorney Fredrickson wasn't aware of the situation and doesn't object.  Court orders a 4-hour furlough with the following conditions:  Must be released on a SCRAM and must not tamper with or remove the unit; must not consume or possess any alcohol; must not operate any motor vehicle; must be in the presence of his mother at all times if reasonable considering the circumstances.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Nicholas Gray to appear at preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing at 03-19-2015 10:00 am

Pre-trial conference on January 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
